Package main.java.progOO2.p05

package main.java.progOO2.p05

Programming Object Oriented II: Whistle

This package continues the introduction to Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), emphasizing how to define a constructor with parameters and how to create methods that represent object behavior.

Key learning goals:

  • Parameterized constructor: The Whistle class uses a constructor to initialize the sound attribute when a new object is created.
  • Behavior through methods: The sound() method demonstrates how objects can perform actions, in this case, printing a specific sound to the console.
  • Encapsulation: The attribute sound is private, reinforcing the principle of keeping internal data hidden and accessed only via methods.

This exercise builds upon earlier concepts and helps students understand how real-world objects can be modeled with both data (attributes) and behavior (methods).

Note: The Whistle class is part of a hands-on learning activity and may be expanded or reused in other object interaction exercises.
